runs.comm: beautiful ball, but hang on it's a no-ball. Dilshan played for the in-swing, because it seemed like it would swing, but nipped away from Dilshan and beat him comprehensively
free-hit is a wide, way outside off
and we get a dot ball finally, back of a length, angling away, Dilshan swings with all his might and misses
another wide here, this time down the leg side, some movement in this time
another no-ball, disastrous over so far, was well bowled though, squaring Dilshan a touch
short, angling across, and smashed through the covers off the back foot
full, on the pads, played with soft hands to mid-on
another wide, angling down the leg, what an over, never-ending. Cows might come home before this one finishes
and now he provides Jayasuriya with a half-volley outside off, Jayasuriya eases into the drive, and beats cover easily
a shout for lbw, this one nipped into Jayasuriya from outside off, but was going high
unfortunate for Tanvir this one, swinging yorker, outside off, Jayasuriya gets an inside edge, and the fine leg is up in the circle
goes for the pull right away, is late into the shot, but gets one to wide of mid-on
hits the bat hard, back of a length. hurrying Jayasuriya into a back-foot defensive
this is good stuff, digs it in short, 89mph, gets good bounce, and the shoulder of Jayasuriya's bat. It's safe, though
bowls it short again, gets it to rise, Jayasuriya gets on his toes, defends with soft hands, and they run right away
Dilshan goes for the pull again, is late into the shot again, but gets one for the mis-timed pull
stays back of a length, gets Jayasuriya to defend again, because of the good bounce he has been getting
back of a length, Dilshan looks to late-cut, but it's too close to his body
fuller, on the pads, shaping in a bit, and he flicks it to square of deep fine leg, superb timing, deep fine leg couldn't even cover 15 metres
cuts him in two, back of a length, outside off, and moves in sharply
another no-ball, Younis could contemplating keeping stumps there instead of the popping crease
wide yorker, and DIlshan misses out on the free hit because this gets them one bye too
slower ball, beats Jayasuriya but down the leg side. Free hit stays
and he bowls a perfect yorker there, single into the leg side
angling into the pads, and turned away to deep backward square
back of a length, on the stumps, bunted into the one side for one
Aamer pitches up to Jayasuriya for the first time, and he flicks it towards midwicket for two
Jaya has had enough of this short-ball business, goes right back into the crease, front leg in air, and he short-arm-pulls it. Superb timing
stays short again, on the stumps, this time it gets a bit big, defended
Dilshan you beauty, the Dilscoop, gets on his knee, Aaamer has bowled this fast, and scoops it from over his head, and clears Akmal easily
looks to pull, the ball lobs off the thigh pad, through to Akmal, and they run one by the time it reaches Akmal
full, into the pads, gets one to mid-on
length ball, on the pads, turned away to leg
short and wide, looks to cut, is slightly late on the shot, gets an underside edge towards the keeper, but along the ground it goes

short, on the stumps, opens the face towards point, who was quite deep. Jayasuriya wants a single, Dilshan is ball-watching, Malik's throw is on the top of the stumps, but Gul is not there to collect it. DIlshan gets a life
wide down the leg side, something wrong with bowling from Nursery End?
tucks him up with a short one, turned around the corner for one
pulled off the front foot, dismissive shot, picked the length early, and finally gets the timing right. Crunchy sound and four runs ensue
Dilshan is scooping them is they were a Sundae. This is the more orthodox scoop if I may say so, as he picks it on the full, and plays it over fine leg as opposed to over the keeper
starts his third over with a yorker, on the leg stump
another yorker, Jayasuriya gets one to midwicket
Dilshan is in his mood now, stands tall and heaves a length ball over midwicket, clean timing and easy four
clears the front leg, looks to heave again, but this is too close to him, and he plays it straight to mid-on
full, on off stump, gets one to mid-off
fulltoss, beats Jayasuriya with the movement in the air, shouts for lbw but this was headed down the leg
full, outside off, flat, played to cover
thrown up, driven powerfully to sweeper-cover
flighted on the stumps, driven into the covers for one
short and wide, cut away down the slope, Dilshan is on fire, and is not looking these gift horses in the mouth
short again, but he has slowed it down this time, Dilshan gets one to short third
thrown up, googly, but it started way down the leg side
flighted, accurate, played back to Afridi
short and quick offbreak, they get a single to sweeper-cover
slower, on the pads, from round the stumps, and turned around the corner
Akmal shouts big, as this one beats Dilshan's slog-sweep, but this one struck him outside off
another superb shot, driven against the turn, powerfully that too, and between point and sweeper-cover
doosra, beats him, something to do for Akmal too
flighted on the off stump, played towards cover for one
cramps him up, on the pads, and Dilshan plays it back to Afridi
short and wide, but can't beat backward point
quicker one, gets the bottom edge, and one to short fine
Jayasuriya goes for the big heave, misses, Afridi shouts for lbw, but this one pitched outside leg
quicker one, on the pads, played towards short midwicket

finally success for Pakistan, Afridi tosses this one the leg stump, Jayasuriya goes for the big slog, gets a top edge, was a googly I suspect, and it skies towards square leg, where Younis takes an easy catch
thrown up on the pads, and played for one to long-on
appreciable break here, thrown up outside off, and beats a defensive shot
full, on the off stump, they get one down to long-off
full he stays, Sangakkara gets an easy one to long-off
shorter, outside off, and he runs it down to sweeper-cover for one
angled in, kisses the pad on the way as it beats Akmal but not short fine leg
short of a length, played with an open face, one run to short third
short, but not much room, he cuts but doesn't get enough power to beat sweeper-cover
short, on the pads, pulled away to deep fine leg
length ball, flat, Dilshan wants one but he has played this straight to point
Afridi has brought Pakistan right back, bowls a vicious quicker googly, Dilshan looks to cut, but there is neither time nor space to do so as he plays it on
full, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
length ball, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
throws it up, on the stumps, and played back to the bowler again
steps out, Malik pushes this one through, beaten in the flight, but will get one
angled into the pads, and played straight to short fine
slower, into the pads, and turned around the corner for one
short, outside off, and played powerfully to extra cover, superb over, just two off it
full and straight, gets one to long-on
Sangakkara finds the boundary, the first in last 28 balls, sweeps a flighted delivery from the leg stump, and finds the gap perfectly
Akmal appeals, for a catch down the leg side, but it's just to test their luck, if they can avoid the wide. No they cannot
nicely chipped over extra cover, safe shot, good-looking shot
full and just outside off, hit to wide of long-off, and they get two
back of a length, outside off, played for one to cover
beats him with the straighter one this time, they look to take the leg-bye, but it's too close to Akmal
steps out, makes this into a fulltoss, and gets one down to long-on
full, outside off, played with an open face towards point
thrown up, on off stump, Sangakkara plays with soft hands and they rush through for one to short third
beautiful shot, wouldn't be out of place in a Test, overpitched, makes some room, and lofts it over extra cover
Ajmal stays full, sweeps, and gets one to square leg
Sangakkara perishes looking to step the rate up, gives Ajmal the charge, who pushes the ball through, and surprisingly Sangakkara ends up playing inside the line, easy stumping for Akmal
nice little dab from Jayawardene, short, on the stumps, Jayawardene leans back and late-cuts it, fine of third man
short and wide, Jayawardene looks to open the face again, but the extra bounce beats him
dug in short, tucking him up, for want of room, Jayawardene can play it limply to behind square on the off side
and he gets a nice little length ball, he nicely leans into the shot, and drives it to between mid-off and extra cover
goes for the bouncer, but down the leg side
back of a length, played towards square leg, and get two before Afridi can get to it from deep backward square
pushes at one outside off, and is beaten
flights it, just outside off, and played down to long-on
doosra, SIlva who was looking to play on the leg side recovers well to get  a single to cover
short and quick, turning in, Jayawardene looks to cut, gets a thick edge that flies fine of short third man
wild throw from Aamer at short third, what would have been a dot ball gets them an overthrow
swept away, gets one to deep backward square
pushed through, Jayawardene makes room, looking to run it down to third man, but it's too close to him

Silva walks down the track, makes sure he has sent a telegram to Gul, who pulls back the length, bowls the slower legcutter that gets the edge and settles in Akmal's gloves. Sri Lanka losing their way
lovely bowling, a quick quick legcutter, 147ks, just back of a length, starts off, and nips back into him, cutting him into two
full, on the pads, and played for one into the leg side
stays back of a length, Jayawardene gets the width, though, and guides it to square of third man for two
length ball, outside off, elegantly played to sweeper-cover
sharp pace again, on the stumps too, length ball, and played straight to extra cover
Jayawardene tries his inside-out shot, has to manufacture it because there is no room, and since he plays it from too close he can't clear Afridi at extra cover, who takes a neat overhead catch
flighted, length ball outside off, dabbed down for one
full, angling in, played down for one to long-on
back of a length, turned around the corner for one
goes for the big hit down the ground, gets an inside edge onto the pad
Ajmal slows it up, Mubarak goes for the big one over cover, but gets only inside edge to short fine
swinging in, full, beats the heave from Mubarak
full and fast, 87mph, played back to Aamer
fulltoss, on off, hit down the ground for one
stays full, swinging in, Mubarak makes room, heaves, but all he gets is one down to long-on
full, fast and full, and only one to midwicket
Mubarak looks for the slog again, this one swings in late again, and beats him, but he gets two leg-byes
full, outside off, swings away, and Mathews is beaten because he is already looking to  make room
finally the boundary Sri Lanka desperately needed, the first in the last five overs, Mathews looks to make room, Gul follows him this time, but it's perfect length for him to scoop over midwicket
full, on the off stump, played to just wide of long-off, but it will be just one
fulltoss, swinging in, played towards long-ff, batsmen desperately go for the second, the throw follows Mubarak to the striker's end, and he is way short, Koertzen doesn't even go to the third umpire
Kulasekera is a sitting duck here, walks across, looks for the big slog, Gul keeps it straight and full, one of the easier lbw decisions
in-swinging yorker, turned towards deep fine leg, they get two
